summary: Completed comprehensive testing of enhanced admin panel with job type field, sidebar navigation, and protected routes. All backend APIs and frontend functionality working correctly.
passed_tests: Health endpoint returns 200 with status: ok
GET /api/jobs returns 6 seeded jobs with type field (Full-time, Contract, Internship)
POST /api/admin/login with correct credentials returns success:true, token, and admin object
POST /api/admin/login with wrong credentials returns 401 with 'Invalid credentials'
POST /api/admin/jobs creates job with type field successfully
PUT /api/admin/jobs/:id updates job with type field successfully
DELETE /api/admin/jobs/:id deletes job successfully
GET /api/admin/applications returns application list
POST /api/apply with valid file uploads successfully
POST /api/apply with invalid file returns 400 error
Homepage loads correctly with hero section and navigation
Careers page shows 7 jobs with colored type badges (Full-time=blue, Contract=amber, Internship=purple, Part-time=green)
Admin login page shows centered glass card with Project P logo
Admin login with correct credentials (admin@projectpinnovations.com) redirects to /admin/dashboard
Admin login with wrong credentials shows 'Invalid email or password' error
Admin dashboard has 280px fixed sidebar with Dashboard, Job Postings, Applications, Email Logs navigation
Dashboard overview shows stats cards (7 Total Jobs, 6 Applications, 7 Emails Sent)
Job Postings table displays jobs with Job Title, Location, Type, Seniority, Created, Actions columns
Create New Job modal opens with all fields including type and seniority dropdowns
Job creation with type field works (created Test QA Engineer as Part-time)
Edit job modal pre-populates form with existing data and saves updates
Delete job shows confirmation and removes job from table (count reduced from 8 to 7)
Protected routes (/admin/dashboard and /admin) redirect to /admin/login when no token
Applications view shows 6 application entries with download resume links
Email Logs view shows 7 email entries with proper MOCKED notice
